hypotheses.prediction: IF CBD (logP 6.3) is administered to isolated hepatocytes at clinically relevant bulk concentrations (1-10 µM), THEN mitochondrial membrane CBD concentration will exceed bulk aqueous concentration by ≥50-fold, achieving local concentrations ≥100 µM sufficient for VDAC1 occupancy (Kd ~11 µM), AND this enrichment will be equivalent (±20%) in healthy hepatocytes vs. HCC cells.
hypotheses.experimental_protocol: Treat primary human hepatocytes and HepG2/Huh7 HCC lines with [³H]-CBD or deuterated CBD (1, 3, 10 µM, 30 min, 37°C). Isolate mitochondria by differential centrifugation, separate membrane fractions by alkaline carbonate extraction, quantify CBD by LC-MS/MS. Normalize to lipid mass by phospholipid assay. Timeline: 4-6 weeks.
hypotheses.expected_outcome: Membrane enrichment ≥50×; no significant difference between healthy and cancer cells (ratio within 0.8-1.2).
hypotheses.null_outcome: Enrichment <50× (occupancy problem stands) OR >3× difference between cell types (selectivity argument partially rescued).
readouts: LC-MS/MS quantification of CBD in membrane vs. cytosolic fractions (pmol/mg lipid vs. pmol/mL cytosol)

hypotheses.prediction: IF CBD is applied to reconstituted VDAC1 in planar lipid bilayers, THEN it will NOT produce zero-conductance block events but WILL shift gating to intermediate subconductance states (30-70% of full open conductance), alter voltage-dependent gating (V₁/₂ shift ≥10 mV), and increase dwell time in subconductance states by ≥3-fold.
hypotheses.experimental_protocol: Reconstitute purified human VDAC1 (E. coli-expressed, refolded) into DPhPC planar lipid bilayers. Record single-channel currents at ±10 to ±60 mV in symmetric 1M KCl before and after cis-side addition of CBD (1, 10, 50, 100 µM in DMSO, ≤0.1% v/v). Analyze conductance histograms, dwell-time distributions, and voltage-gating curves. Repeat with VDAC2. Timeline: 8-12 weeks.
hypotheses.expected_outcome: Novel subconductance peaks at 40-70% of full open; V₁/₂ shift ≥10 mV; no complete block events; similar effects on VDAC2.
hypotheses.null_outcome: Complete block (zero conductance) events dominating—indicating pore occlusion; OR no effect on gating at any concentration tested.
controls: cholesterol (lipid-partitioning control with no known gating effect)

hypotheses.prediction: IF CBD binds VDAC1 with Kd ~11 µM, THEN it will bind VDAC2 with Kd within 5-fold (2-55 µM), AND CBD treatment (10-50 µM) will increase BAK oligomerization and cytochrome c release in healthy hepatocytes, an effect that is rescued by VDAC2 overexpression and phenocopied by VDAC2 knockdown.
hypotheses.experimental_protocol: (A) Binding: Express/purify human VDAC1 and VDAC2 in lipid nanodiscs; measure CBD binding by microscale thermophoresis (MST) or ITC. (B) Functional: Treat primary human hepatocytes (± VDAC2 siRNA or VDAC2-FLAG overexpression lentivirus) with CBD (5, 10, 25, 50 µM, 6-24h). Measure BAK oligomerization (BMH crosslinking + western), cytochrome c release (mitochondrial vs. cytosolic fractionation + ELISA), and caspase-3/7 activity. Timeline: 10-14 weeks.
hypotheses.expected_outcome: Kd ratio <5×; CBD increases BAK oligomerization and cytochrome c release
hypotheses.null_outcome: Kd ratio >10× (selectivity exists); OR CBD has no effect on BAK/cytochrome c in healthy hepatocytes even at 50 µM; OR VDAC2 manipulation does not modulate CBD's apoptotic effect.
controls: z-VAD-FMK (pan-caspase inhibitor to confirm apoptotic pathway)

hypotheses.prediction: IF CBD is applied to matched primary human hepatocytes and HCC cell lines, THEN the EC50 for GSH depletion (to <50% baseline) will differ by <3-fold between cell types, GSH depletion will require [CBD] ≥20 µM (above therapeutic free hepatic levels), AND the ROS scavenging capacity ratio (healthy:HCC) will be <2× as measured by DCFDA kinetics.
hypotheses.experimental_protocol: Treat primary human hepatocytes (≥3 donors) and HCC lines (HepG2, Huh7, SNU-449) with CBD (1, 5, 10, 25, 50, 100 µM) for 2, 6, 12, 24h. Measure total GSH/GSSG by enzymatic recycling assay (Tietze), ROS by CM-H2DCFDA kinetics (plate reader, 0-60 min post-CBD), mitochondrial superoxide by MitoSOX, and viability by ATP-based assay (CellTiter-Glo). Pre-treat subset with NAC (5 mM) or BSO (100 µM, GSH synthesis inhibitor). Timeline: 4-6 weeks.
hypotheses.expected_outcome: GSH depletion EC50 ratio (healthy:HCC) <3×; both >20 µM; ROS scavenging ratio <2×; NAC rescues viability in both cell types similarly.
hypotheses.null_outcome: EC50 ratio >5× (meaningful selectivity exists); OR ROS scavenging ratio >3×; OR GSH depletion occurs at <10 µM in HCC but >50 µM in healthy cells.
